faculty.Research Interests: Quantum Information Theory, Quantum Control Theory, Quantum Synchronisation, Non-Equilibrium Statistical Mechanics

Additional Details.Group Website: Not explicitly provided, but text mentions 'Please visit our group website for details'
Additional Details.Courses Taken: PH403 Quantum Mechanics, PH534 Quantum Information, PH202 Waves and Oscillations, PH117 Laboratory
Additional Details.Alumni: Dr. Parvinder Solanki (Currently at the University of Basel)
Additional Details.Current Students: Muthumanimaran Vetrivelan, Abhisek Panda, Midhun Krishna, Yeshma Ibrahim

Theoretical High Energy Physics.Research Area/Description: Research focuses on elementary particle physics, physics beyond the Standard Model, exploring various open questions related to the Higgs boson, top quark physics, proton spin, neutrino physics, flavor physics, unified theories, supersymmetry, topological quantum field theories, AdS-CFT correspondence, astroparticle physics, and early universe cosmology including matter-antimatter asymmetry, dark matter, and inflationary paradigm.

Ongoing Projects.project_name: Higgs and Top quark physics in beyond Standard Model (bSM) models
Ongoing Projects.description: Exploring collider signatures of new physics contributions to Higgs and top quark observables, through polarization and jet substructure studies both at the Large Hadron Collider (LHC) and the proposed International Linear Collider (ILC).
Investigating how the proton's spin is built up from the intrinsic spin of quarks and gluons and their orbital angular momentum.
Exploring the smallness of neutrino masses, their mixings, mass hierarchy, CP violation, and Majorana nature.
Investigating the masses and mixings of fermions in the Standard Model, CP violating parameters, and their connection to baryon asymmetry.

Studying supersymmetry and its implications for the standard Higgs, exploring left-right symmetric extended supersymmetric models and their ability to explain matter-antimatter asymmetry and neutrino mass.

Ongoing Projects.project_name: Topological Quantum Field Theories and knot theory
Ongoing Projects.description: Working on knot polynomials using Chern-Simons topological field theory.
Utilizing string theory-gauge theory dualities to understand counting of BPS states and transport properties like shear viscosity to entropy density ratio.
Exploring mechanisms for generating matter-antimatter asymmetry in the early universe, including the role of topological defects.
Investigating the particle nature of dark matter and potential candidates within extended models.
Studying the properties of the inflaton field and its impact on the Cosmic Microwave Background Radiation.
